abstract.p: Felicity Frisbie letter, commenting on July 12 article, questions how anyone can spend $1,500 on meal at Alain Ducasse when so much poverty abounds worldwide

How can anyone enjoy a $1,500 meal at Ducasse when there is so much poverty in this world (''The Perfect Tempest: A Sneak Preview of Ducasse,'' July 12)? Didn't their mothers ever tell them that there are children starving in China? And India? And Africa?

And right here in New York City there are plenty of kids who don't have the things that most of us take for granted. Here's a suggestion for some of those 2,700 people on the waiting list at Alain Ducasse. Cancel your reservation, and use the money to:
* Pay for 20 weeks of tutoring for a child who can't read.
* Send four kids to summer camp.
* Sign up a team of 10-year-olds for indoor basketball for the whole winter.
* Give a child a year and a half of piano lessons.
* Throw 12 kids their very own bowling and pizza birthday party for 10 friends.
* Buy a whole class of schoolchildren new sneakers.
* Buy 78 children a copy of the new Harry Potter book.
* Take 500 kids out for tacos with rice and guacamole.
* Treat 1,000 sweaty children to an ice cream on a hot summer night.
